content.text:
# Recent ElizaOS GitHub Updates

## New Features
- Added a button for directing to home/chat page (PR #3770)
- Optimized fact retrieval, added environment fixes, and implemented reflection guard (PR #3766)
- Added logs functionality (PR #3774)
- Added weekly contributor meeting notes for February 18 and 25, 2025 (PR #3769)
- Added "What Did You Get Done This Week? 12" notes (PR #3768)

## Bug Fixes
- Fixed API issues (PR #3767)
- Fixed build errors (PR #3765)
- Fixed splitText and optimized processCharacterKnowledge (PR #3763)
- Fixed linting and syntax errors in core swarm components (PR #3761)
- Fixed Docker image for CI/CD setup (PR #3732)
- Improved quickstart, plugin showcase, and fixed documentation (PR #3772)

## Documentation Updates
- Removed duplicate documentation in plugins.md (PR #3764)
- Updated quickstart with Twitter configurations (PR #3778)
- Added development approach for Windows Users (PR #1618)

## Other Changes
- Added v2 lint and documentation build improvements (PR #3780)
- Made v2 specific initialization changes (PR #3773)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, covering documentation, features, fixes, and improvements:

- Documentation updates include weekly contributor meeting notes for February 18 and 25, 2025 (PR #3769), and "What Did You Get Done This Week? 12" notes (PR #3768), both submitted by YoungPhlo.

- Feature additions include support for creating pools, opening positions with liquidity, and adding/removing liquidity in the SUI plugin (PR #3777 by 0xBondSUI), and a new logs functionality (PR #3774 by wtfsayo).

- Improvements and fixes include an enhanced quickstart guide and plugin showcase (PR #3772 by madjin), a splitText fix and processCharacterKnowledge optimization (PR #3763 by odilitime), static migrations fix (PR #3771 by 0xbbjoker), and general linting and dependency cleanup for clients/smm agent (PR #3781 by yungalgo).

categories.title: Updates from dankvr and shawmakesmagic on Twitter

content.text: dankvr has been commissioning weekly update montages for @ai16zdao and @elizaos, noting that information gets scattered across social channels. They plan to develop a news or blog site to document the complete history and make it accessible for agents to ingest via RSS.
dankvr also shared a tweet with the message 'become so busy you don't even check the charts' accompanied by an image.
Meanwhile, shawmakesmagic announced that they will restart agent dev school next week, not this week as they want to finish the groundwork for v2 first.
There were also brief interactions where dankvr asked about files linked in metadata or available online, and shawmakesmagic responded to bryan_johnson with 'Ya hmu let's do it'.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. Issue #3783: A user named Ulysseus reported that the agent won't post to Twitter, with an error message indicating an unsupported provider called 'venice'.

2. Issue #3779: User notorious-d-e-v reported that the parseJSONObjectFromText functionality broke in version 0.25.9 or earlier.

3. Issues #3775 and #3776: User 0xBondSUI submitted two feature requests for the plugin-sui component. One requests support for swapping any token pair, while the other asks for additional functionality including creating pools, opening positions, and adding/removing liquidity.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From March 4-5, 2025, there were 9 new pull requests with 8 being merged, no new issues, and 11 active contributors. The following day (March 5-6, 2025) saw 7 new pull requests with 8 merged, 4 new issues, and an increase to 14 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained steady development momentum with a slight increase in contributor participation.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
